title: M2M Reports Optimization & Enhancement
description:
Description
1. Epic Description
Epic (Requirement and Scope) 
An optimization or additional development for existing reports is currently delivered by the BI4BS team based on a new story in JIRA. 
Based on business needs it is required to change the logic in existing reports, add some new fields or adapt the existing ones. Changes are required to fix known issues, performance problems and improve usability.
Currently there is a new requirement for Standard reporting: Customers want to know about remaining suspension days of their SIM cards.
Benefits:
Stable environment
Customer satisfaction.
Specific Deliverables  
Adapted reports with updated logic and new fields to display REMAINING_SUSPENSION_DAYS  information:
WEBi, ARV: 018_STD_SIM_BASICDATA report.
Update of the Reporting user manual to reflect the changes in the reports and how to use the REMAINING_SUSPENSION_DAYS field.
Documentation describing the changes in report logic and their impact on business processes, SSV updates.
Acceptance Criteria (conditions which must be satisfied for the Epic to be accepted)
New REMAINING_SUSPENSION_DAYS is added after the existing attribute LAST_STATUS_CHANGE_TIMESTAMP in 018_STD_SIM_BASICDATA report.
Only DAILY and MONHTLY WEB and ARV reports are affected.
Out of Scope
Creation of new reports, system architecture changes, or integration with new data sources. The focus is solely on updating existing columns with additional options.
Dependencies 
 The mapping in the source system is clear and accessible, and the changes have been approved by a business side.
  2. Technical / Solution Design / Compliance
Technical & Solution Design  
The proposed solution involves modifying existing reports to incorporate additional values for REMAINING_SUSPENSION_DAYS information and update the logic accordingly. This aligns with the architectural roadmap by ensuring compatibility with current systems and minimizing disruption. The implementation will utilize existing technologies and frameworks, with a focus on improving report performance while maintaining data integrity. The mapping in the source system is clear and accessible, ensuring a smooth integration process.

None.
  4. SLA(if any)
Service Level Agreements
Ensuring that modified reports are delivered within the agreed timeframe.
